title: AI Chat App
shortDesc: AI chat application integrated with GitHub Models and offline-first architecture.

problem.title: Challenge
problem.desc: Standard Expo Go <highlight>lacks native module access</highlight> and network instability causes message handling issues

solution.title: Solution
solution.desc: Adopt Bare Workflow for deep native integration with Optimistic UI and Pre-network Persistence strategy

impact.title: Impact
impact.desc: Achieved <highlight>High-Reliability Error Recovery</highlight> and <highlight>Optimistic UI with Pre-network Persistence</highlight>

overview.description: A high-performance AI chat application built on Expo Bare Workflow, leveraging GitHub Models for high-performance LLM integration and SQLite for secure data persistence.

challenges.title: Deep Native Integration via Bare Workflow
challenges.symptom: Standard Expo Go restricted custom native module extensibility
challenges.rootCause: Managed workflow abstracts native layer, blocking advanced haptics and system-level UI controls
challenges.impact: Unable to implement context menus and advanced gesture handling

details: Migrated from Managed to Bare Workflow
Retained Expo DX while gaining native project access
solution.result: Full control over Android/iOS projects with Expo's rapid iteration benefits

challenges.title: Persistence Strategy Balancing Responsiveness and Durability
challenges.symptom: Trade-off between immediate user feedback and data persistence guarantees
challenges.rootCause: Pure optimistic UI risks data loss; pure DB-first creates perceived latency
challenges.impact: Needed instant feedback while ensuring messages are staged locally before the network request

details: Immediate UI updates provide zero-latency perceived experience
Mandatory SQLite write stages data locally prior to asynchronous API calls
Ensures data durability for manual recovery even if the app crashes or network fails
solution.result: Verified high-reliability data protection with extreme perceived responsiveness

challenges.title: Inverted List Implementation
challenges.symptom: Chat messages displayed in wrong order (newest at top)
challenges.rootCause: Standard FlatList renders items top-to-bottom, opposite of chat UX expectations
challenges.impact: Users expected newest messages at bottom with auto-scroll
challenges.codeSnippet:
<FlatList
  ref={flatListRef}
  inverted
  data={messages}
  keyExtractor={(item) =>
    item.id.toString()
  }
  renderItem={renderMessageItem}
/>

details: Newest messages appear at bottom automatically
Maintains scroll position on new messages
solution.result: Natural chat interface with correct message ordering

items.title: Why GitHub Models?
items.reason: Cost-effective for research with free tier during development
details: Seamless API integration with multiple LLM providers
Architected for future scalability to support GPT-4, DeepSeek, and other LLMs via a unified API
No credit card required for initial development phase

items.title: Why SQLite?
items.reason: Complex data relations required a relational database
details: AsyncStorage inadequate for structured data with relationships

items.title: Why Context Menu?
items.reason: Native iOS experience for message actions
